content.question: Which of the following is the best method for preparing <math alttext="100.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mn>100.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> of <math alttext="1.00 molar K C l, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.00</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>KCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>?

choices.label: Place <math alttext="74.6 grams" overflow="scroll"><mn>74.6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>KCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> in a <math alttext="100 milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> graduated cylinder and fill to the <math alttext="100.0 milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mn>100.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> mark with water.

Place <math alttext="7.46 grams" overflow="scroll"><mn>7.46</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>KCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> in a <math alttext="100 milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> Erlenmeyer flask, add <math alttext="92.54 grams" overflow="scroll"><mn>92.54</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of water, and invert several times.

Place <math alttext="7.46 grams" overflow="scroll"><mn>7.46</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>KCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> in a <math alttext="100 milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> volumetric flask, partially fill with water, swirl flask to dissolve solid, fill to the <math alttext="100.0 milliliter" overflow="scroll"> <mn>100.0</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>mL</mi> </math> mark with water, and invert several times.

Place <math alttext="7.46 grams" overflow="scroll"><mn>7.46</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>KCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> in a <math alttext="100 milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> volumetric flask, partially fill with water, swirl flask to dissolve solid, add <math alttext="92.54 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mn>92.54</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> of water, and invert several times.

content.answer: Place <math alttext="7.46 grams" overflow="scroll"><mn>7.46</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of <math alttext="K C l, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>KCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> in a <math alttext="100 milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> volumetric flask, partially fill with water, swirl flask to dissolve solid, fill to the <math alttext="100.0 milliliter" overflow="scroll"> <mn>100.0</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>mL</mi> </math> mark with water, and invert several times.

skill.text: 2.C: Identify experimental procedures that are aligned to a scientific question (which may include a sketch of a lab setup).
